font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;
font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: /auth success response: IdP-signed Bearer JWT, containing Client PubKey

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400;
text.tspan: Auth token should not contain variable content to control size

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400;
text.tspan: If desired, we could include baseline config like default KAS URL

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: /userinfo AuthZ Request claims (client subj/obj attributes) JWT w/PubKey

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400;
text.tspan: TBD - where does Attribute Provider store/retrieve client attribs from?

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400;
text.tspan: Probably shouldn't be PolicyStore - or should it?

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: Request user's Virtru claims (aka attributes) from /userinfo, passing Client PubKey

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: Return Virtru claims (client subj/obj attributes) from claim store, containing Client PubKey

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: /userinfo success response: IdP-signed Virtru claims (client attributes) JWT

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;
font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;
font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: /rewrap with bearer JWT in Auth header, full claims JWT from IdP + client-signed nonce in body

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: Get OIDC JWT signing key from IdP that issued bearer token

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: validate {bearer|claims} JWTs with IdP's signing key

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: Validate {bearer|claims} JWTs have same client pubkey embedded, and that that key validates client-signed nonce in request payload

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400;
text.tspan: An IdP's bearer token and claims token will always be signed by the SAME KEY

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400;
text.tspan: ...but there is no reason why multiple claims tokens from different IdP couldn't be included

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400;
text.tspan: We can always use claims token `iss` to fetch the public signing key via OIDC well-known URLs

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: Fetch policy ID referred to in /rewrap payload

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;
font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: Upsert policy and return policy from store

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;
font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;
font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: /resolvePolicy with client's subject claims, stored/upsert-ed object claims, and ID of Rego policy to eval

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400;
text.tspan: OPA does not appear to directly validate JWT signature itself

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400;
text.tspan: Decide if KAS validation of claims JWT is enough

text.style: font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;
font-family: "trebuchet ms", verdana, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400;

svg.text: /rewrap response (DENIED or ALLOWED with rewrapped key)
